com.cleo.lexicom.external

Class LexiComPipedOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.PipedOutputStream
        • com.cleo.lexicom.external.LexiComPipedOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class LexiComPipedOutputStream
extends java.io.PipedOutputStream
    Pipe an incoming payload file out through another mailbox while still writing to the original destination; fail the transfer if the pipe fails and vice versa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LexiComPipedOutputStream(java.io.File file, java.util.Map map, IMailboxController imc, boolean deleteOnError)
      Pipe an incoming payload file out through another mailbox

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexiComPipedOutputStream

        public LexiComPipedOutputStream(java.io.File file,
                                java.util.Map map,
                                IMailboxController imc,
                                boolean deleteOnError)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Pipe an incoming payload file out through another mailbox
        Parameters:
        file - original destination file which should still be written
        map - original destination properties
        imc - IMailboxController to also pipe out the payload
        deleteOnError - true if the original destination file should be deleted if the IMailboxController send fails
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • setGeneralErrorMessage

        public void setGeneralErrorMessage(java.lang.String generalErrorMessage)
        Set the error message to be logged by the receiving protocol thread if the IMailboxController send fails
        Parameters:
        generalErrorMessage - error message to be logged, which cannot be a null or empty string; defaults to "Error processing incoming file"

        Set whether the IMailboxController send error message should be included in the error message logged by the receiving protocol thread
        Parameters:
        includeMailboxControllerErrorMessage - true if should include mailbox controller send error message; defaults to false
